tit.j: 同志社大学今出川校地

sen.j: 同志社大学今出川校地（どうししゃだいがくいまでがわこうち）は同志社大学のキャンパス。
sen.e: Doshisha University Imadegawa-kochi is the campus of Doshisha University.
Doshisha University Imadegawa-kochi is the campus of Doshisha University.
Doshisha University Imadegawa-kochi is the campus of Doshisha University.

sen.j: 同志社大学ではキャンパスのことを「校地」と呼んでいるため、この記事の名称も今出川校地となっている。
sen.e: Because Doshisha University calls its campus "kochi", Imadegawa-kochi is used as the title of this article.
Because Doshisha University calls its campus "kochi", Imadegawa-kochi is used as the title of this article.
Because Doshisha University calls its campus 'kochi,' Imadegawa-kochi is used as the title of this article.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を変えました。

sen.j: 今出川校地は旧薩摩藩邸の跡地で、隣接して冷泉家時雨亭文庫がある。
sen.e: Imadegawa-kochi was the site of Satsuma domain's residence in the past, and Reizeike Shiguretei Bunko is located adjacently.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Imadegawa-kochi was the site of the Satsuma domain residence in the past, and Reizeike Shiguretei Bunko is located adjacently.
Imadegawa-kochi was the site of the Satsuma domain residence in the past, and Reizeike Shiguretei Bunko (Shiguretei bunko library of the Reizei family) is located adjacently.

sen.j: また、南に京都御所、北に相国寺がある。
sen.e: Also, Kyoto Imperial Palace and Shokoku-ji Temple are located its south and north side respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Also, the Kyoto Imperial Palace and Shokoku-ji Temple are located at its north and south sides respectively.
Also, the Kyoto Imperial Palace and Shokoku-ji Temple are located at its north and south sides respectively.

sen.j: 今出川校地内では同志社礼拝堂、クラーク記念館など、5棟が国の重要文化財に指定されている。
sen.e: Five buildings located at Imadegawa-kochi, including Doshisha Chapel and Clarke Memorial Hall, are designated as national important cultural properties.
Five buildings located at Imadegawa-kochi, including Doshisha Chapel and Clarke Memorial Hall, are designated as national important cultural properties.
Five buildings located at Imadegawa-kochi, including Doshisha Chapel and Clarke Memorial Hall, are designated as national important cultural properties.

sen.j: これらの建物は現在でも講義・事務所・礼拝等に使用されている。
sen.e: These buildings are being used for lecture, office and worship even at present.
These buildings are being used for lectures, offices, and worship even at present.
These buildings are being used for lectures, offices, and worship even at present.

sen.j: 校地内には同志社中学校が存在しているが、2010年度に岩倉校地にある同志社高等学校との統合と中学校跡地を大学が利用することが決定している。
sen.e: Doshisha Junior High School is currently located at Imadegawa-kochi, but the decision was made to integrate it with Doshisha High School, which is located at Iwakura-kochi, in 2010 and use the site of junior high school for university's facility.

Doshisha Junior High School is currently located at Imadegawa-kochi, but the decision was made to integrate it with Doshisha High School, which is located at Iwakura-kochi, in 2010 and use the site of junior high school for the university's facility.

Doshisha Junior High School is currently located at Imadegawa-kochi, but the decision was made to integrate it with Doshisha High School, which is located at Iwakura-kochi, in 2010 and use the site of junior high school for the university's facility.

sen.j: また、同志社女子大学今出川校地、同志社幼稚園、同志社女子中学校・高等学校が隣接。
sen.e: Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts Imadegawa-kochi, Doshisha Kindergarten and Doshisha Girl's Junior & Senior High School are also located adjacently.
Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts Imadegawa-kochi, Doshisha Kindergarten and Doshisha Girl's Junior & Senior High School are also located adjacently.
Doshisha Women's College of Liberal Arts Imadegawa-kochi, Doshisha Kindergarten and Doshisha Girl's Junior and Senior High School are also located adjacently.

sen.j: 今出川・同志社大学新町校地・同志社大学室町校地の3校地は近接しており、ほぼ一体として利用されており、3校地を併せて今出川校地と呼ぶことが多い。
sen.e: As Doshisha University's Imadegawa-kochi, Shinmachi-kochi and Muromachi-kochi are located in proximity, these three campuses are being used in an integrated fashon and they are often collectively called Imadegawa-kochi.

As Doshisha University's Imadegawa-kochi, Shinmachi-kochi and Muromachi-kochi are located in proximity, these three campuses are being used in an integrated fashon and they are often collectively called Imadegawa-kochi.

As Doshisha University's Imadegawa-kochi, Shinmachi-kochi and Muromachi-kochi are located in proximity, these three campuses are being used in an integrated fashion and they are often collectively called Imadegawa-kochi.

sen.j: 同志社大学の前身・同志社英学校時代以来の校地である。
sen.e: It was initially the campus of Doshisha English School, the predecessor of Doshisha University.
It was initially the campus of Doshisha English School, the predecessor of Doshisha University.
It was initially the campus of Doshisha English School, the predecessor of Doshisha University.

sen.j: 幕末の1862年以降この地（当時は相国寺二本松と呼ばれた）には薩摩藩京都藩邸が置かれていた。
sen.e: Since 1862, the end of Edo period, Kyoto residence of Satsuma domain was located at this place (this place was called Shokoku-ji Temple Nihonmatsu at the time).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Since 1862, the end of the Edo period, the Kyoto residence of the Satsuma domain was located at this place (this place was called Shokoku-ji Temple Nihonmatsu at the time).
Since 1862, the end of the Edo period, the Kyoto residence of the Satsuma domain was located at this place (this place was called Shokoku-ji Temple Nihonmatsu at the time).

sen.j: 洋学者・山本覚馬（のち同志社英学校の創立者・新島襄の義兄・協力者となる）が明治維新の混乱の中で藩邸跡地を購入していた。
sen.e: Under the state of confusion resulted from Meiji Restoration, Western learning scholar Kakuma YAMAMOTO (the brother-in- law and collaborator of Jo NIIJIMA, the founder of Doshisha English School) purchased the site of domain's residence.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Under the state of confusion resulting from the Meiji Restoration, Western learning scholar Kakuma YAMAMOTO (the brother-in- law and collaborator of Jo NIIJIMA, the founder of Doshisha English School) purchased the site of the domain's residence.

Under the state of confusion resulting from the Meiji Restoration, Western learning scholar Kakuma YAMAMOTO (the older brother-in-law and collaborator of Jo NIIJIMA, the founder of Doshisha English School) purchased the site of the domain's residence.
sen.cmt: スペース削除、補足しました。

sen.j: 同志社英学校が1875年11月29日に開校した時には京都市上京区寺町丸太町上ルの高松保実の屋敷（現在は新島旧邸）の一角を借り、教室として寄宿舎として利用していた。
sen.e: When Doshisha English School was opened on November 29, 1875, it rented a part of Sasuzane TAKAMATSU's residence (current Niijima's former residence) for classrooms and dormitories.
When Doshisha English School was opened on November 29, 1875, it rented a part of Sasuzane TAKAMATSU's residence (current Niijima's former residence) for classrooms and dormitories.
When Doshisha English School was opened on November 29, 1875, it rented a part of Sasuzane TAKAMATSU's residence (current Niijima's former residence) for classrooms and dormitories.

sen.j: そのおよそ半年後の1876年山本からの寄贈をうけた現・今出川校地に建物が竣工し英学校が移転した。
sen.e: In 1876, about a half year after its opening, the land of current Imadegawa-kochi was donated by Yamamoto and the school constructed buildings and moved there.
In 1876, about a half year after opening, the land of the current Imadegawa-kochi was donated by Yamamoto and the school moved there and constructed buildings.
In 1876, about a half year after opening, the land of the current Imadegawa-kochi was donated by Yamamoto and the school moved there and constructed buildings.

sen.j: 当初は2棟（第一寮､第二寮）の建物で1階を教室、2階を寄宿舎として使用していた。
sen.e: There were two buildings (first building, second building) initially, and the first floor was used as classrooms while the second floor was used as dormitories.
There were two buildings (first building, second building) initially, and the first floor was used as classrooms while the second floor was used as dormitories.
There were two buildings (first dormitory, second dormitory) initially, and the first floor was used as classrooms while the second floor was used as dormitories.

sen.j: また、同志社はキリスト教主義であるが、当時の京都ではキリスト教を排除する傾向にあり、住民の反対運動が相次いだ。
sen.e: As Doshisha was a school which believed in Christianity, opposition movements were vigorously organized by residents since the social environment in Kyoto was not in favor of Christianity at the time.
As Doshisha was a school that believed in Christianity, opposition movements were vigorously organized by residents since the social environment in Kyoto was not in favor of Christianity at the time.
As Doshisha was a school that believed in Christianity, opposition movements were vigorously organized by residents since the social environment in Kyoto was not in favor of Christianity at the time.

sen.j: そのため、今出川校地において教育を行う際に聖書を教えてはいけないとの契約を京都府とも結んでいた。
sen.e: Under such circumstances, the school concluded the agreement with Kyoto Prefecture which prohibited it from teaching Bible at Imadegawa-kochi.
Under such circumstances, the school concluded an agreement with Kyoto Prefecture which prohibited it from teaching the Bible at Imadegawa-kochi.
Under such circumstances, the school concluded an agreement with Kyoto Prefecture which prohibited it from teaching the Bible at Imadegawa-kochi.

sen.j: そこで新島襄は現在のアーモスト館あたりにあった元豆腐屋を新島名義で買い上げ、学校外のその場所で聖書を教えることとなった。
sen.e: Then, Jo NIIJIMA bought a bean curd shop located near current Amherst House under his name and taught Bible at this place instead of at school.
Then, Jo NIIJIMA bought a bean curd shop located near current Amherst House under his name and taught the Bible at this place instead of at the school.
Then, Jo NIIJIMA bought a bean curd shop located near current Amherst House under his name and taught the Bible at this place instead of at the school.

sen.j: しかし、実際には学校内で聖書を教えていたところを京都府の役員に発見されて新島が始末書を書いたこともある。
sen.e: In fact, however, there was a case where the scene of teaching Bible at school was found by an official of Kyoto Prefecture and Niijima wrote a letter of apology.
In fact, however, there was a case where teaching the Bible at school was discovered by an official of Kyoto Prefecture and Niijima wrote a letter of apology.
In fact, however, there was a case where teaching the Bible at school was discovered by an official of Kyoto Prefecture and Niijima wrote a letter of apology.

sen.j: レンガ造りの建物がほとんどを占める同志社の建物だが最初に建てられたものは木造であった。
sen.e: Although current buildings of Doshisha are mostly brick-build ones, the original buildings were wooden buildings.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Although current buildings of Doshisha are mostly brick, the original buildings were wooden.
Although current buildings of Doshisha are mostly brick, the original buildings were wooden.

sen.j: 同志社に初めて登場するレンガ造りの建物は1884年に完成したアメリカン・ボードより寄付された彰栄館（京都で現存する最古のレンガ造り）である。
sen.e: Doshisha's first brick-build building was Shoei-kan (the oldest brick-build building in existence in Kyoto), which was completed in 1884 and donated by the American Board.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Doshisha's first brick building was Shoei-kan (the oldest brick building in existence in Kyoto), completed in 1884 and donated by the American Board.
Doshisha's first brick building was Shoeikan (the oldest brick building in existence in Kyoto), completed in 1884 and donated by the American Board.
sen.cmt: 同志社ウェブサイトでの表記に合わせました。

sen.j: 第二寮はその後1970年代に京田辺校地に移築された。
sen.e: The second building was moved and reconstructed at Kyotanabe-kochi in 1970's.
The second building was moved and reconstructed at Kyotanabe-kochi in 1970's.
The second dormitory was moved and reconstructed at Kyotanabe-kochi in 1970's.

sen.j: 学部：神、文、社会、法、経済、商学部の各3～4年次および政策学部全学年
sen.e: Under graduate schools : Third and fourth academic year of School of Theology, Faculty of Letters, Faculty of Social Studies, Faculty of Law, Faculty of Economics and Faculty of Commerce as well as all academic years of Faculty of Policy Studies

Under graduate schools: Third and fourth academic years of the School of Theology, Faculty of Letters, Faculty of Social Studies, Faculty of Law, Faculty of Economics, and Faculty of Commerce as well as all academic years of the Faculty of Policy Studies

sen.j: 研究科：神学、文学、社会学、法学、経済学、商学、アメリカ、総合政策科学研究科
sen.e: Graduate schools : Graduate School of Theology, Graduate School of Letters, Graduate School of Social Studies, Graduate School of Law, Graduate School of Economics, Graduate School of Commerce, Graduate School of American Studies and Graduate School of Policy and management

Graduate schools: Graduate School of Theology, Graduate School of Letters, Graduate School of Social Studies, Graduate School of Law, Graduate School of Economics, Graduate School of Commerce, Graduate School of American Studies, and Graduate School of Policy and management

sen.j: 神学部、社会学部は2009年度に今出川校地へ統合。
sen.e: School of Theology and Faculty of Social Studies were moved to Imadegawa-kochi in 2009.
School of Theology and Faculty of Social Studies were moved to Imadegawa-kochi in 2009.
School of Theology and Faculty of Social Studies were moved into Imadegawa-kochi in 2009.

sen.j: 文学部心理学科は心理学部として改組され2009年度に全学年京田辺校地へ移転。
sen.e: Psychology Department of Faculty of Letters was reorganized into Faculty of Psychology and was moved to Kyotanabe-kochi in 2009.
Psychology Department of Faculty of Letters was reorganized into Faculty of Psychology and was moved to Kyotanabe-kochi in 2009.
Psychology Department of Faculty of Letters was reorganized into Faculty of Psychology and its all academic years was moved to Kyotanabe-kochi in 2009.

sen.j: 文学部、法学部、経済学部、商学部も2013年度までに今出川校地に統合が予定されている。
sen.e: Faculty of Letters, Faculty of Law, Faculty of Economics and Faculty of Commerce are also expected to be moved to Imadegawa-kochi by 2013.
Faculty of Letters, Faculty of Law, Faculty of Economics, and Faculty of Commerce are also expected to be moved to Imadegawa-kochi by 2013.
Faculty of Letters, Faculty of Law, Faculty of Economics, and Faculty of Commerce are also expected to be moved into Imadegawa-kochi by 2013.

sen.j: 日本におけるプロテスタント派の煉瓦造りの礼拝堂としては現存する最古のもの。
sen.e: It is the oldest brick-build Protestant chapel in existence in Japan.
It is the oldest brick Protestant chapel in existence in Japan.

sen.j: 施工は有終館も請け負った三上吉兵衛。

sen.j: ステンドグラスが美しく、徳冨蘆花の小説、『黒い眼と茶色の目』の中で「五色の光線」が降ると形容された。
sen.e: As its stained glass is so beautiful, Roka TOKUTOMI described in his novel "Black eyes and brown eyes" as "five-colored rays are falling".
The stained glass is so beautiful, Roka TOKUTOMI described in his novel "Black eyes and brown eyes" as "five-colored rays are falling."

sen.j: 1987年から1990年まで半解体修理工事が行われた。
sen.e: It was partly dismantled and repaired from 1987 to 1990.

sen.e: It was partly dismantled and repaired from 1987 to 1990.

sen.j: 現在も礼拝堂として使用されており、毎週礼拝も行われている。
sen.e: It is still used as a chapel at present and worship is conducted every week.
It is still used as a chapel at present and worship is conducted every week.
It is still used as a chapel at present and worship is conducted every week.

sen.j: また、週末には同志社関係者に限り結婚式を挙げることもできる。

sen.j: 竣工した当時は日本最大の学校図書館建築物であった。
sen.e: At the time of its completion, it was the biggest school library building in Japan.
At the time of its completion, it was the biggest school library building in Japan.
At the time of its completion, it was the biggest school library building in Japan.

sen.j: 設計はD.Cグリーン。

sen.j: 初代大学図書館。
sen.e: It was the university's first library.
It was the university's first library.
It was the university's first library.

sen.j: 1928年昭和天皇が即位式で在京の折、この有終館が出火した。
sen.e: A fire broke out at Yushu-kan in 1928 when the Emperor Showa was staying in Kyoto for the enthronement ceremony.
A fire broke out at Yushu-kan in 1928 when Emperor Showa was staying in Kyoto for the enthronement ceremony.
A fire broke out at Yushukan in 1928 when Emperor Showa was staying in Kyoto for the enthronement ceremony.
sen.cmt: 前出表記に合わせました。

sen.j: 即位式典の場所である御所は、同志社今出川校地に隣接しており、大学当局は即位式の間、全学あげて構内の警備をしていた。
sen.e: As the Imperial Palace, the venue of enthronement ceremony, was adjacent to Doshisha Imadegawa-kochi, the authority of university was in full alert during the period of enthronement ceremony.
As the Imperial Palace, the venue of enthronement ceremony, was adjacent to Doshisha Imadegawa-kochi, the authority of university was on full alert during the period of enthronement ceremony.
As the Imperial Palace, the venue of enthronement ceremony, was adjacent to Doshisha Imadegawa-kochi, the authority of university was on full alert during the period of enthronement ceremony.

sen.j: ところがその詰所にしていた部屋の木製の大火鉢が加熱して出火してしまったのである。
sen.e: Nevertheless, a fire broke out because a big wooden hibachi (heating appliance) in the guard station was overheated.
Nevertheless, a fire broke out because a big wooden hibachi (heating appliance) in the guard station overheated.
Nevertheless, a fire broke out because a big wooden hibachi (heating appliance) in the guard station overheated.

sen.j: これにより当時の総長および理事、監事は引責辞職。
sen.e: The president, directors and auditors of the university at the time resigned from their posts to take responsibility for the above incident.
The president, directors and auditors of the university at the time resigned from their posts to take responsibility for the above incident.
The president, directors and auditors of the university at the time resigned from their posts to take responsibility for the above incident.

sen.j: 燃え残った有終館の駆体は撤去の予定であったが、当時隣の同志社女学校の建築を手がけていた武田五一が修理・保存を勧告した。
sen.e: Though Yushu-kan's framework that survived the fire was expected to be demolished, Goichi TAKEDA, who was engaged in the construction of adjacent building of Doshisha Girl's school, recommended to repai and preserve it.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Though Yushu-kan's framework that survived the fire was expected to be demolished, Goichi TAKEDA, who was engaged in the construction of an adjacent building of Doshisha Girl's school, recommended repairing and preserving it.

Though Yushukan's framework that survived the fire was expected to be demolished, Goichi TAKEDA, who was engaged in the construction of an adjacent building of Doshisha Girl's School, recommended repairing and preserving it.
sen.cmt: 前出表記に合わせました。

sen.j: 結局外壁の内部に15cmの鉄筋コンクリートの壁を作る方法で保存した。
sen.e: Eventually, it was preserved by means of installing ferroconcrete wall of 15-centimeter thick on the inside of outer wall.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Eventually, it was preserved by means of installing ferroconcrete walls, 15-centimeter thick on the inside of outer walls.
Eventually, it was preserved by means of installing ferroconcrete walls, 15-centimeter thick on the inside of outer walls.

sen.j: 有終館の名は図書館としての役目を終えた際に当時の総長であった海老名弾正が命名した。
sen.e: This building was named Yushu-kan by Danjo EBINA when its role as library ended.
This building was named Yushu-kan by Danjo EBINA when its role as a library ended.
This building was named Yushukan by Danjo EBINA when its role as a library ended.
sen.cmt: 前出表記に合わせました。

sen.j: ドイツのネオ・ゴシックを基調とする建築物で、「印象的な尖塔は同志社大学のシンボル的存在」と同志社大学関係者は考えている。
sen.e: It is a German neo-gothic style building, and people relating Doshisha University think that "its impressive spire is something like a symbol of Doshisha University".

sen.j: 27歳でこの世を去った息子（バイロン・ストーン・クラーク）のためにとB.W.クラーク夫妻より6000ドル寄付され建設された。
sen.e: It was constructed with the donation of 6.000 dollars by Mr. and Mrs. Clarke, who donated this amount in memory of their son Byron Stone Clarke who died at the age of 27.
It was constructed with the donations of 6.000 dollars by Mr. and Mrs. Clarke, who donated this amount in memory of their son Byron Stone Clarke who died at the age of 27.
It was constructed with the donations of 6,000 dollars by Mr. and Mrs. Clarke, who donated this amount in memory of their son Byron Stone Clarke who died at the age of 27.

sen.j: そのため1階の壁面に「THE STUDY OF THE WORD OF GOD WAS DEAR TO HIM」（神の言葉の研究は彼にとって大切であった、の意）と刻まれている。
sen.e: Therefore, a phrase "THE STUDY OF THE WORD OF GOD WAS DEAR TO HIM" was engraved on the wall of first floor.

sen.j: この際、後世に改造された部分などは撤去され、当初の姿に復元された。
